thread.title: Crashing global dairy price curdles Bega Cheese's profit
thread.title_full: Crashing global dairy price curdles Bega Cheese's profit

title: Crashing global dairy price curdles Bega Cheese's profit
text:
Bega is betting on packaged cheese to boost its sales. Photo: Supplied
A near halving in global dairy prices has wiped 26 per cent off Bega Cheese's underlying profit.
But the company is expecting better financial results in the coming year, despite predicting the volatility on global dairy markets will continue.
Executive chairman Barry Irvin said he expected improvement from the dairy producer's increased focus on consumer packaged goods, such as supermarket packed cheeses and infant formula rather than bulk commercial dairy ingredients.
Bega Cheese director Barry Irvin. Photo: Louise Kennerley
Its strategy helped lift revenue 4 per cent to $1.1 billion in the 12 months to June 30 after sales of nutritional powder and consumer packed goods surged $72 million.
Advertisement "[But] growth in revenue from the group's value-added platforms was offset by a $29 million decrease in the value of global dairy commodity prices, particularly skim milk powder," Mr Irvin said.
The global price of skim milk powder has almost halved since March, diving from $US2935 ($4119) to $US1521 a tonne.
"The decrease in global commodity prices consequently directly impacted margins and financial outcomes of the group in FY15," Mr Irvin said.
Bega's net profit plunged to $22 million compared with the 2014 financial year. This excluded last year's sale of its shares in Warrnambool Cheese and Butter, which reaped a $62 million pre-tax profit in FY14, and a $25 million investment in growing a sustainable milk supply.
The company generated earnings per share of 14.4 cents, down 27 per cent from 2014.
It will pay a final dividend of 4.5 cents a share, which is unchanged from 2014's payout, on September 18.
More to come...
